title: Metastability and polymorphism in dihydroxybenzenes – implications for thermal energy storage
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, 3,413-418
DOI: 10.1039/D3YA00510K, Communication
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Tomas S. Northam de la Fuente, Mattia Gaboardi, Kalith M. Ismail, Valerio Di Lisio, Daniele Cangialosi, Alberto Otero-de-la-Roza, Pedro B. Coto, Felix Fernandez-Alonso
State-of-the-art experimental and computational techniques have been used to explore the effects of molecular isomerism on the phase behaviour of the three dihydroxybenzenes catechol, resorcinol, and hydroquinone.
